casebody.data:
Kyle M. SHORT, Appellant,
v.
Michael S. WRIGHT, Scott Schoenfeld and Ryan Welschmeyer, Respondents. No. ED 107067 Missouri Court of Appeals, Eastern District, DIVISION TWO. Filed: March 12, 2019 ATTORNEYS FOR APPELLANT: Kyle M. Short, Pro Se, M.E.C.C. #1059205, Old Highway 66, Pacific, MO 63069. ATTORNEYS FOR RESPONDENT: Travis A. Elliott, 901 St. Louis Street, Suite 600, Springfield, MO 65806. Before Philip M. Hess, P.J. and Robert G. Dowd, Jr. and Mary K. Hoff, JJ.

ORDER

PER CURIAM.

Kyle M. Short ("Appellant") appeals the judgment dismissing his petition for declaratory judgment. Because Appellant failed to state a claim, we affirm.

An opinion would have no precedential value nor serve any jurisprudential purpose. The parties have been furnished with a memorandum for their information only, setting forth the reasons for this order pursuant to Rule 84.16(b).
